1.description: Require phishing-resistant MFA for all services to the extent possible, particularly for webmail, VPN, and accounts that access critical systems.

2.description: Disable command-line and scripting activities and permissions to prevent privilege escalation and lateral movement.

3.description: Implement verbose and enhanced logging within processes such as command line auditing and process tracking.

4.description: Restrict the use of PowerShell using Group Policy and only grant access to specific users on a case-by-case basis.

5.description: Update Windows PowerShell or PowerShell Core to the latest version and uninstall all earlier PowerShell versions.

6.description: Enable enhanced PowerShell logging, including module, script block, and transcription logging.

7.description: Restrict the use of RDP and other remote desktop services to known user accounts and groups.

8.description: Implement application controls to manage and control execution of software, including allowlisting remote access programs.

9.description: Keep all operating systems, software, and firmware up to date. Prioritize patching known exploited vulnerabilities in internet-facing systems.

10.description: Segment networks to prevent the spread of ransomware.

11.description: Identify, detect, and investigate abnormal activity and potential traversal of the indicated ransomware with a network monitoring tool.

12.description: Audit user accounts with administrative privileges and configure access controls according to the principle of least privilege.

13.description: Implement time-based access for accounts set at the admin level and higher.

14.description: Implement a recovery plan to maintain and retain multiple copies of sensitive or proprietary data and servers in a physically separate, segmented, and secure location.

15.description: Maintain offline backups of data and regularly maintain backups and their restoration.

16.description: Ensure all backup data is encrypted, immutable, and covers the entire organizationâ€™s data infrastructure.

17.description: Forward log files to a hardened centralized logging server, preferably on a segmented network.

18.description: Consider adding an email banner to emails received from outside your organization.
